blocks.name: cpw
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include power class. (The tilde in the Metamath token is meant to suggest the calligraphic font of the P.)
blocks.origin: prop class cpw(class c0) { P(c0) }

blocks.name: diff.cpw.s
diff.cpw.c
diff.cpw.w
pwjust
blocks.content: Soundness justification theorem for ~ df-pw . (Contributed by Rodolfo Medina, 28-Apr-2010.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 29-Jun-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm pwjust(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wceq(cab(s0, wss(cv(s0), c0)), cab(s1, wss(cv(s1), c0)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  eqtri(cab(s0, wss(cv(s0), c0)), cab(s1, wss(cv(s1), c0)), cab(hs0, wss(cv(hs0), c0)))
  cbvabv(s0, hs0, wss(cv(s0), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c0))
  sseq1(cv(s0), cv(hs0), c0)
  cbvabv(hs0, s1, wss(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cv(s1), c0))
  sseq1(cv(hs0), cv(s1), c0)
  diff.wss.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(wss(cv(s0), c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wss(cv(s1), c0))
  diff.wss.s(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm pwjust(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ { s0 | s0 ‚äÜ c0 } = { s1 | s1 ‚äÜ c0 }
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  eqtri({ s0 | s0 ‚äÜ c0 }, { s1 | s1 ‚äÜ c0 }, { hs0 | hs0 ‚äÜ c0 })
  cbvabv(s0, hs0, s0 ‚äÜ c0, hs0 ‚äÜ c0)
  sseq1(s0, hs0, c0)
  cbvabv(hs0, s1, hs0 ‚äÜ c0, s1 ‚äÜ c0)
  sseq1(hs0, s1, c0)
  diff.wss.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(s0 ‚äÜ c0)
  diff.hs0.w(s1 ‚äÜ c0)
  diff.wss.s(s1, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: df-pw
blocks.content: Define power class. Definition 5.10 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 17, but we also let it apply to proper classes, i.e. those that are not members of ` _V ` . When applied to a set, this produces its power set. A power set of S is the set of all subsets of S, including the empty set and S itself. For example, if ` A = { 3 , 5 , 7 } ` , then ` ~P A = { (/) , { 3 } , { 5 } , { 7 } , { 3 , 5 } , ` ` { 3 , 7 } , { 5 , 7 } , { 3 , 5 , 7 } } ` ( ~ ex-pw ). We will later introduce the Axiom of Power Sets ~ ax-pow , which can be expressed in class notation per ~ pwexg . Still later we will prove, in ~ hashpw , that the size of the power set of a finite set is 2 raised to the power of the size of the set. (Contributed by NM, 24-Jun-1993.)

blocks.name: pweq
blocks.content: Equality theorem for power class. (Contributed by NM, 21-Jun-1993.)

blocks.name: pweqi
blocks.content: Equality inference for power class. (Contributed by NM, 27-Nov-2013.)

blocks.name: pweqd
blocks.content: Equality deduction for power class. (Contributed by NM, 27-Nov-2013.)

blocks.name: elpw
blocks.content: Membership in a power class. Theorem 86 of [Suppes] p. 47. (Contributed by NM, 31-Dec-1993.)

blocks.name: selpw
blocks.content: Setvar variable membership in a power class. See ~ elpw . (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 8-Dec-2018.)

blocks.name: elpwg
blocks.content: Membership in a power class. Theorem 86 of [Suppes] p. 47. See also ~ elpw2g . (Contributed by NM, 6-Aug-2000.)

blocks.name: elpwd
blocks.content: Membership in a power class. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Oct-2020.)

blocks.name: elpwi
blocks.content: Subset relation implied by membership in a power class. (Contributed by NM, 17-Feb-2007.)

blocks.name: elpwb
blocks.content: Characterization of the elements of a power class. (Contributed by BJ, 29-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: elpwid
blocks.content: An element of a power class is a subclass. Deduction form of ~ elpwi . (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)

blocks.name: elelpwi
blocks.content: If ` A ` belongs to a part of ` C ` then ` A ` belongs to ` C ` . (Contributed by FL, 3-Aug-2009.)

blocks.name: nfpw
blocks.content: Bound-variable hypothesis builder for power class. (Contributed by NM, 28-Oct-2003.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Oct-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm nfpw(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wnfc(s0, cpw(c0))
  -| wnfc(s0, c0)
} = {
  nfcxfr(s0, cpw(c0), cab(hs0, wss(cv(hs0), c0)))
  df-pw(hs0, c0)
  nfab(s0, hs0, wss(cv(hs0), c0))
  nfss(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  nfcv(s0, cv(hs0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm nfpw(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ F/(s0, P(c0))
  ‚ä£ F/(s0, c0)
} = {
  nfcxfr(s0, P(c0), { hs0 | hs0 ‚äÜ c0 })
  df-pw(hs0, c0)
  nfab(s0, hs0, hs0 ‚äÜ c0)
  nfss(s0, hs0, c0)
  nfcv(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: pwidg
blocks.content: Membership of the original in a power set. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: pwid
blocks.content: A set is a member of its power class. Theorem 87 of [Suppes] p. 47. (Contributed by NM, 5-Aug-1993.)

blocks.name: pwss
blocks.content: Subclass relationship for power class. (Contributed by NM, 21-Jun-2009.)
